titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette, Notary Public, J. D. Pollard
CWG2099

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL
THOMAS E. BRAMLETTE,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH.
To all whom these Presents shall come, Greeting:

Know Ye, That reposing especial trust and confidence in the integrity, diligence, and ability of J. D. Pollard, I do hereby appoint him NOTARY PUBLIC, in and for the County of Franklin, hereby investing him with full power and authority to execute and fulfill the duties of the said office according to law: And to have to hold the same, with all the rights and emoluments thereunto legally appertaining, until the end of the next session of the General Assembly, if so long he shall behave well.

figure.ab:
SEAL OF KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL

body.p: In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent and the Seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at Frankfort, the 6th day of April, in the year of our Lord, one thousand eight hundred and 65, and in the 73rd year of the Commonwealth.

Thos E Bramlette
BY THE GOVERNOR:
E. L. VanWinkle, Secretary of State.
By Jas E. Page
Asst Secty
Commonwealth Office -- WM. E. HUGHES, State Printer.
